Pre-Game Insights: Arizona Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The Philadelphia Phillies are confident going into Game 6, with designated hitter Kyle Schwarber stating they are ready to get back and be prepared.
Starting Lineups: D-backs: Corbin Carroll, RF, Ketel Marte, 2B, Gabriel Moreno, C, Christian Walker, 1B, Tommy Pham, DH, Lourdes Gurriel Jr., LF, Alek Thomas, CF, Evan Longoria, 3B, Geraldo Perdomo, SS
Phillies: Kyle Schwarber, DH, Trea Turner, SS, Bryce Harper, 1B, Alec Bohm, 3B, Bryson Stott, 2B, J.T. Realmuto, C, Nick Castellanos, RF, Brandon Marsh, LF, Johan Rojas, CF
Others: The game is being televised in the U.S. on TBS. All series are available in the U.S. on MLB.TV with authentication to a participating Pay TV provider. Games are available live internationally (except in Canada). Full game archives are available approximately 90 minutes after the game ends.
The D-backs will have a fully loaded bullpen for Game 6, as none of their leverage relievers threw in Game 5. Expect Lovullo to be aggressive in going to the bullpen with the season on the line.

If the Phillies have a lead in Game 6, don’t expect to see right-handers Craig Kimbrel or Orion Kerkering in high-leverage situations, unless absolutely necessary. Instead, those situations will fall to José Alvarado, Jeff Hoffman, Seranthony Domínguez and Matt Strahm.
